title: 2025 Indy Shorts International Film Festival Lineup Announced
body_text:
EXCLUSIVE: Motorsports and basketball. Indianapolis has become a mecca for those activities as the home of the Indy 500 and the Pacers (who came up just short of winning the NBA crown this year). In recent years, Indianapolis has also become an important destination for cinephiles through the work of Heartland Film, the nonprofit that puts on the Heartland International Film Festival in October, and the Oscar-qualifying Indy Shorts International Film Festival in July.
Today, Heartland Film announced the lineup for the 8th edition of Indy Shorts, running from July 22-27 in the Indiana capital. More than 250 short films of virtually every genre will be showcased, among them 41 world premieres, 18 U.S. premieres and 113 Midwest premieres.
“Many of the premiering films have notable names,” the festival comments, including Imelda Staunton (The Most Powerful Human on Earth); André Holland (A Love Letter to M); Lena Headey (Long Pork); Domhnall Gleeson (Retirement Plan); Wallace Shawn and CCH Pounder (The Clock); Rosie O’Donnell (She Raised Me); Amy Sedaris (Happy to Help You); Sophia Di Martino (Undeletable); Stephen Fry and Miriam Margolyes (A Friend of Dorothy); singer-actor Poppy (The Most Perfect Perfect Person), and many others.
Watch on Deadline
The documentary categories will feature work by two-time Oscar winner Ben Proudfoot (Doc Albany); Brad Bailey (Her Fight, His Name: The Story of Gwen Carr and Eric Garner); Layla Absalon (the world premiere of Remembering Indiana Avenue); Alex Herz (the world premiere of Middleground), and many more.
Emmy-winning producer and editor Doug Blush (The Elephant Whisperers, 20 Feet From Stardom) will receive the 2025 Indy Shorts Pioneering Spirit Award on Saturday, July 26, an event that will include a special screening of his newly-produced short documentaries.
“Indy Shorts has built an internationally-renowned grassroots reputation for strong thematic programming, top tier hospitality and creating a summer camp atmosphere where filmmakers become fast friends and long-lasting collaborators,” Heartland Film Artistic Director Greg Sorvig said in a statement. “Special thank you to our premiere titles who have entrusted us to launch their festival runs, many featuring familiar faces in audacious new roles.”
The festival is Academy Award-qualifying in all three short film Oscar categories: Live Action, Animated, and Documentary. “With a track record of 39 nominations and 10 Oscar-winning shorts in recent years, there’s a good chance attendees will see the next Academy Award-contending films first in Indianapolis,” the festival notes. “Indy Shorts is also a qualifying film festival for the BAFTA and Goya Awards.”
Indy Shorts is presented by F.A. Wilhelm Construction Co. Possibly taking its cue from that sponsorship, “the 2025 festival is embracing a building/construction theme that encourages attendees to dig into 253 groundbreaking short films that are curated into 39 themed programs. From comedy to horror, there’s a shorts program for everyone. This year, there are also three Indiana Spotlight Programs made up of 19 films by filmmakers with Hoosier ties.”
These are the jurors who will determine awards (which come with a total of more than $35,000 in cash prizes):
- Narrative Jury | Cindy Lee, Jens Georg and Joey Moser
- Documentary Jury | Nicholas Ma, Jenifer McShane and Julio Palacio
- Animated Jury | Shelia Lynne Bolda, Rebecca Martin Fagerholm and Jamie-James Medina
- Indiana Spotlight Jury | Alicia Kozma, Sam Miro and Deonna Watherly
- High School Film Competition Jury | Mark Cabus, Grace Hanna and Gunnar Sizemore
2025 Indy Shorts Programs
FILM TITLE | YEAR | COUNTRY | DIRECTOR(S) | PREMIERE STATUS | DESCRIPTION
**World Premiere
*US Premiere
ALTERNATIVE WORLDS
Gaze into different dimensions where reality is not what it seems.
Goodbye Sun | 2024 | France | Hakim Atoui | Midwest Premiere | Eleven-year-old Luna lives with her big brother, Julien, and her two adoptive fathers. It’s the end of summer and the heat is stifling as they impatiently await the solar eclipse that everyone has been talking about. The sun disappears behind the moon but it does not reappear.
**Pinion | 2025 | United States | Will Wertz | World Premiere | In a bleak corporate-run world, a caged man faces relentless questioning, his reality unraveling.
Strangers Like Us | 2024 | Austria | Felix Krisai, Pipi Frostl | Midwest Premiere | In their early 30s, Laura and Elias settle into a new suburban life by inviting another couple over for dinner. When the night gradually turns into an evening full of mysteriously surreal events, Laura feels like a stranger in her own life.
Skroll | 2024 | Netherlands | Marten Visser | Humans and some kind of gnomes have posted videos on social media platforms in their animated dimension. This film is a short compilation of these clips.
Two People Exchanging Saliva | 2024 | France, United States | Natalie Musteata, Alexandre Singh | In a farcical world where kissing is punishable by death, a personal shopper threatens the status quo.
*Worst. Experience. Ever. | 2024 | United Kingdom | Alex Boutell | U.S. Premiere | Maya’s days working at a small shop take a surreal turn when her boss makes a bombshell revelation. As unsettling truths begin to surface, Maya discovers her supposedly ordinary life might be an elaborate fabrication. In this darkly comic tale, a simple confession spirals into an existential crisis.
AROUND AMERICA
Journey across the United States, from Yellowstone National Park to the southern border and beyond, in this captivating collection of documentaries.
A Drastic Tale | 2024 | United States | Chantel Simpson | Midwest Premiere | “A Drastic Tale” explores the deep, unwavering brotherhood formed between members of Drastic Auto Club, one of the oldest lowrider clubs in New York City.
Appalheads | 2024 | United States | Scott, Faris | Midwest Premiere | Decades after leaving Appalachia, a daughter returns to eastern Kentucky to excavate her father’s remarkable filmmaking legacy—as the founder of Appalshop—and reflect on the pull home still has on her.
Beneath the Same Sky | 2024 | United States | Christine Kane | Midwest Premiere | In El Paso’s borderlands, Fidel confronts life as a Border Patrol agent. Caught between two nations, he enforces the law while uncovering human stories of dreams pursued and lost, hopes carried and ultimately shattered.
Get Your Line In & Pray | 2025 | United States | Jackson Adams | Every January, 10,000 people descend on Brainerd, Minnesota to compete in the world’s largest charitable ice fishing competition. The event impacts nearly every aspect of life in the area for days on end, but perhaps none more than the local bait shop, owned and operated by self-described “crabby old lady” Sherree Wictor. With intimate knowledge of the culture, history, and eccentric clientele the competition brings, Sheree offers her personal opinion of what makes it special—and how to win it.
How the Land Remembers Us | 2024 | United States | Jared Wahkinney | Midwest Premiere | Amidst Yellowstone National Park’s 150th anniversary, Indigenous artists gather to celebrate their connection with the place, revealing a story of how the land remembers them through past, present, and future generations.
MEET MR. MEAT | 2024 | United States | David Walsh Heinz | Midwest Premiere | Mr. Meat is a 150-pound pig who lives in the middle of Los Angeles alongside 12 million humans. This is the story of him and his adoptive family.
This land | 2024 | United States | Mike Bradley | The untold story of Ganienkeh, a Mohawk community fighting to regain its traditional culture.
AROUND THE WORLD
Stamp your passport as you travel alongside subjects of these international stories.
Butterfly | 2024 | France | Florence Miailhe | In the sea, a man swims.
Correct Me If I’m Wrong (如你所愿) | 2025 | Germany, United States, China | Hao Zhou | Caught in a struggle of love, legacy and belief, a Southwest Chinese family seeks to rid their queer heir of what they perceive as an unwanted entity.
Death Education | 2025 | China | Yuxuan Ethan Wu | Midwest Premiere | In China, a high school teacher has introduced a death education class for young students. On the traditional Tomb Sweeping Day, they bury unnamed ashes at a public cemetery where they contemplate and contextualize the meaning of death.
**LARGO | 2024 | United Kingdom | Salvatore Scarpa, Max Burgoyne-Moore | World Premiere | A young Syrian refugee living in the UK without his parents attempts to build a boat and sail home to find them.
*Patience (Sabali) | 2024 | France, Senegal, Algeria | Valentin Guiod | U.S. Premiere | Sabali which means “patient” and “immortal,” tells the story of Moudou’s exodus and the resilience of his migration. It follows his clandestine odyssey, struggle for love and above all, his patience.
Sarah Thankam Mathews: After All This | 2024 | United States, Oman | Andrew Nadkarni | Midwest Premiere | Following the success of her debut novel, “All This Could Be Different”, author Sarah Thankam Mathews embarks on her second novel, drawing from her adolescence between India and Oman. As Sarah excavates lost place and time, she must contend with the weight of truthful representation and the contradictions within her childhood memories.
SUSANA | 2025 | Mexico, United States | Amandine Thomas & Gerardo Coello Escalante | A middle-aged American woman finds herself alone in Mexico City. When she encounters a group of young American tourists, she jumps at the opportunity for a little adventure.
BETTER TOGETHER
From prison inmates to puzzle enthusiasts, profound human connections are forged by unforeseen circumstances and unlikely places.
A Film in Another Language | 2024 | United States, United Kingdom | César Velasco | Midwest Premiere | An immigrant unable to speak the local language, Mya works as a dishwasher in a busy restaurant. After finding a homeless man in need of medical assistance, a miscommunication with a police officer leads to a series of strenuous situations.
Camp Widow | 2025 | United States | Laura Green, Anna Moot-Levin | Midwest Premiere | An immersion into a weekend gathering of “widows”–people of all ages, genders and orientations–this glimpse of a grieving community is by turns devastating and unexpectedly funny.
Classroom 4 | 2025 | United States | Eden Wurmfeld | Midwest Premiere | “Classroom 4” follows a course taught inside a prison, involving students from a nearby college and incarcerated students, about the history of crime and punishment in the U.S.
Livestreams with GrandmaPuzzles | 2024 | United States | Emily Sheskin | A life-long hobby becomes a lifeline for an unexpected Twitch streamer.
Dream Car Wash | 2024 | United Kingdom | Edoardo Brighenti | Midwest Premiere | “Dream Car Wash” follows Sara, an Iranian-Italian immigrant in London, through her daily struggle at a car wash. Amidst mundane routines and fleeting encounters, Sara’s inner dream of becoming a professional dancer yearns for expression.
Mildred 4 a Million | 2024 | United States | Kimmie P Callaway | Midwest Premiere | A gregarious great-grandmother who desperately wants to connect with her tablet-obsessed great-granddaughter sets out to get a million followers on TikTok. Starring TV legend Marla Gibbs, this poignant comedy explores human connection across generations in the age of tech addiction.
*Morning | 2024 | United Kingdom | Olivia J. Middleton | U.S. Premiere | A couple seek to find solace in the aftermath of a domestic tragedy.
CARE & CONVICTION
Community, care, and advocacy are paramount in three documentaries featuring survivors changing the Troubled Teen Industry and doctors making a difference.
**The Business of Trouble | 2025 | United States | Kristi Jacobson | World Premiere | In The Business of Trouble, survivors, a former caregiver, and an investigator reveal systemic abuse and demand accountability from the private equity companies behind the multibillion-dollar Troubled Teen Industry that exploits vulnerable youth under the guise of care.
Country Doctor | 2025 | United States | Shari M Cookson, Nick E Doob | Midwest Premiere | “Country Doctor” follows Dr. James Graham, a physician in a struggling Oklahoma town, as he fights to save its bankrupt hospital. Filmed over three years, the documentary captures a rural community’s resilience amid crisis and uncertainty.
Doc Albany | 2025 | United States | Ben Proudfoot | Midwest Premiere | OB/GYN Dr. Sheena Favors must choose between city life or staying in rural Georgia to provide vital maternal care, following Doc Hollywood’s real-life inspiration, Dr. James Hotz.
COMEDY
Get ready to laugh out loud in this wild collection of comedic shorts!
Crab Claw | 2024 | United States | Steve Sanders | A couple in therapy must face the source of their marital problems: the wife’s crab claw.
Drop Off | 2025 | United States | Ric Serena | One couple’s unravelling as parenting takes its toll.
Eureka! | 2024 | Belgium | Kris Borghs | An extraterrestrial duo crosses the universe to share technological insights with less brilliant minds. On one peculiar planet, things don’t quite go as planned.
Learning How To Drive | 2024 | United States | Tyler Cunningham | Midwest Premiere | Bettina, a recent LA transplant and struggling actress-turned-babysitter, must chauffeur precocious preteen Wynn, to a birthday party in Laurel Canyon. There’s just one problem: she barely knows how to drive a car.
Poreless | 2025 | United States | Harris Doran | Midwest Premiere | A fabulous, queer, Muslim beauty entrepreneur has to figure out how to compete in a “Shark Tank”-like beauty pitch contest after suffering an untimely allergic reaction.
Protagonist Gene | 2025 | United States | Kyle Leland Cullerton | A timid woman is medically diagnosed as a Supporting Character and must undergo a radical procedure in order to attain Main Character energy.
Retirement Plan | 2024 | Ireland | John Kelly | In the throes of his overstimulated, energy poor midlife, Ray (Domhnall Gleeson) fantasizes about everything he’d love to do in retirement, once he finally has the “time.”
Royal Foot Guards | 2025 | United States | Pranay Mathur | Midwest Premiere | Desperate to finally pass the test to become a Royal Foot Guard at Buckingham Palace, Chester Popplestone must surrender his delightfully cheery nature and embrace the world for what it is.
Sandra | 2025 | United States | Hannah Levy, Jen Chuck | Jane’s predictable life with her boyfriend is upended when she finds out that a mysterious and erratic woman has been living in her basement.
Tacocunr | 2025 | United States | Erin Brown Thomas | One woman’s valiant attempt to log into her email.
TEASER TRAILER | 2024 | United States | JJ Gibson | The ultimate trio of unlikely heroes battle an action movie teaser trailer that’s out to kill them.
Tuesday | 2024 | United States | Amanda Pinto | Midwest Premiere | Two work besties spiral when a last-minute Zoom call leaves them thinking they’re getting fired.
Two Minutes | 2024 | United Kingdom | Jamie Benyon | Midwest Premiere | Two brothers rob a convenience store but get interrupted by their Nan.
CONVERSATIONS
Interpersonal communication takes center stage in this mix of witty and revelatory dialogue-driven stories.
*Bye. | 2025 | Spain | Álvaro G. Company,Mario Hernández | U.S. Premiere | Is it possible to forgive ourselves for our mistakes? One afternoon in the park, Elena and Ángela will have to confront their inner demons as they try to heal the wounds of the past, with one sole purpose: Carmen’s well-being.
The Clock | 2024 | United States | Cameo Wood | Midwest Premiere | “The Clock” is an intimate and thought-provoking film in the mystery, drama and thriller genres, centered around a resilient 75-year-old woman, Elle Rivers. During a break-in by a masked burglar, Elle engages in an unexpected conversation with the intruder, revealing her belief that her life will end at midnight, evidenced by a mysterious clock counting down in her dreams since childhood.
Fire At Will | 2025 | United States | Morgan Gruer | Midwest Premiere | When parents gather their four adult children over dinner to solidify the family will, the childrens’ self-absorbed agendas send the conversation careening into chaos, leading to a desperate battle of wills.
From You | 2024 | Poland | Jędrzej Gorski | A story of a father and son who, after the death of their famous journalist grandfather, come together for one night to discuss the deceased. Everything takes a turn when hidden family secrets come to light, reshaping the dynamics of their relationship.
*Hurricane | 2025 | Spain | Saúl Gallego | U.S. Premiere | When Clara enters a coffee shop and recognizes Fernando, a retired film director and one of her idols, she decides to invite him for a coffee. The young woman’s curiosity makes the man share with her the most important moments of his career, including the enigmatic reason that led him to retire 30 years ago.
PLAY HARD | 2024 | United States | Winter Dunn | Midwest Premiere | Nate, a workaholic drummer, spends all his time practicing, always striving for perfection. After he meets Yazmine, a like-minded, dedicated modern dancer, he realizes that the key to success isn’t just to work hard–sometimes it requires you to play hard.
Strangers in the Same Shirt | 2024 | United States | Anthon Chase Johnson | Two estranged siblings reconnect at their father’s third wedding. But when the younger sister finds herself in need of some help, her older brother is there with oddly good advice. They both get a taste of what it means to be a sibling, even if they have no common history.
**Undeletable | 2024 | United Kingdom | Benjamin Blaine, Christopher Blaine | World Premiere | Emma has to inform her dad’s recently confessed lover that he has died but the painful mistakes she makes whilst recording this answerphone message confronts her with a brutal truth about the remorseless forward nature of time.
DARK COMEDY 1
Behold, a collection of funky, eccentric and sometimes satirical offbeat comedies.
Baby Tooth | 2024 | United States | Olivia Accardo | Midwest Premiere | Marina has enlisted the help of a stranger to get rid of either her baby tooth, or her boat, whichever he prefers.
Cherry-Colored Funk | 2025 | United States | Chelsie Pennello | Midwest Premiere | A serial grifter faces the music when seemingly everyone he’s ever wronged shows up on the opening day of his dubious Italian ice business.
COO-RAGE | 2024 | Netherlands | Alina Milkina | Midwest Premiere | Urban pigeons are seen as pests, as rats of the sky. They are rudely chased away and their nests are removed. When a group of pigeons hears that the mayor promises housing for everyone, they decide to submit a petition at the town hall. But first, they have to get past the evil janitor.
**Curtains | 2024 | United States | Ophelia Wolf | World Premiere | A type-A opera AD has 15 minutes to get a diva baritone on stage while navigating the backstage chaos of a live production.
Endzgiving | 2024 | United States | Tina Carbone | This is gonna be Will’s last Friendsgiving.
Out for Delivery | 2025 | United States | Chelsea Christer | When terminally ill Joanna seeks end of life care through Death With Dignity, the systems in place to make her death peaceful become the opposite.
Randy As Himself | 2025 | United States | Margaret Miller | Midwest Premiere | A Hollywood production crew comes to West Texas to recreate the grisly murder of a local woman. Using locals to re-enact the crime, Reality TV meets Reality in this bizarre romantic comedy about the (show) business of murder.
Time Flies | 2024 | United States | LJ Burnett | With only one day to live, two flies scramble to make the most of their time before it runs out.
DARK COMEDY 2
Behold, yet another mercurial mix of absurd and sometimes-murderous dark comedies.
Cheat Meal | 2024 | United States | Drew Bierut | Midwest Premiere | Suspicious that his girlfriend is cheating on him with her new personal trainer, Owen decides to take matters into his own hands. What he discovers is far more difficult to digest.
Death of an actor | 2024 | France | Ambroise Rateau | Midwest Premiere | When a man learns that fake news regarding his own death is spreading like wildfire on social media, he’ll be forced to deal with the unintended consequences of this rumor.
Gender Reveal | 2024 | Canada | Mo Matton | Midwest Premiere | Rhys, a dedicated people pleaser, winds up at their boss’ gender reveal party with their two partners. The trans throuple soon realizes that they are dealing with more than they were prepared for and their ability to survive the event comes into question.
*Keep your rubbish | 2024 | France | Laura Ghazal | U.S. Premiere | In the midst of a garbage strike, with mountains of trash cans around every corner, an influential TikTokeuse challenges her followers to reduce their waste by recycling and storing it at home. The #gardetespoubelles challenge goes viral, and for the influencer, it turns into an obsession.
**Peace, Quiet & a Little Dirt | 2025 | United States | Kevin Samar | World Premiere | A chance encounter between a veteran and rookie leads to an unexpected passing of the torch.
She Raised Me | 2025 | United States, Canada | Ben Lewis | Midwest Premiere | When a struggling writer discovers he’s dating the son of his favorite actress, he’ll do anything to make (and keep) a meaningful connection.
Quota | 2024 | Netherlands | Studio Job, Joris & Marieke | When every global citizen is required to have their CO2 emissions tracked, it makes little impact…that is, until they discover the consequences of reaching their designated quota.
EPISODIC
New at Indy Shorts, a dedicated program showcasing episodic projects, including proof-of-concepts and pilots!
Centaur Baby | 2024 | United States | Elvira Ibragimova | Midwest Premiere | It’s Halloween; we’re at a cramped, sweaty, costume party where a break up, a proposal and a meet-cute all happen at once.
Chasers | 2025 | United States | Erin Brown Thomas | At a Los Angeles house party, an aspiring musician pursues her crush through a crowd of hopeful dreamers chasing empty promises.
Crazy As A Loon | 2024 | United States | Monica Raymund | Midwest Premiere | “Crazy As A Loon” is a short/proof of concept for the TV Series “Committed”, set during the time of The Lavender Scare in 1953 Washington, D.C. A family’s matriarch is hunted down by an underground government unit the night of her son’s birthday party, exposing more than her perpetrators bargained for.
The Incredible Sensational Fiancée of Sèyí Àjàyí | 2024 | United States, Nigeria | Abbesi Akhamie | Midwest Premiere | In the African retro-futuristic nation of Alkebulan, a brilliant scholar discovers her fiancé’s secret engagement and takes spectacular revenge, unexpectedly earning the recognition she always deserved.
Neo Dome | 2024 | United States | Bonnie Discepolo | A woman hitchhikes to a utopia on the horizon. When she negotiates a ride we learn: trust no one on the road to the Dome.
FAMILY TIES
Stories centered on intergenerational relationships, identity dynamics and seeing each other in fascinating new ways.
**A reflection of me | 2025 | Sweden | Stephane Mounkassa, Stefan Sundin | World Premiere | Mikael, born in Sweden, feels caught in in-betweenness. His grandfather visits for the first time from Congo Brazzaville and the two develop an unexpected bond when Mikael needs it the most.
Grandma Nai Who Played Favorites | 2025 | Cambodia/France/USA | Chheangkea | During her chaotic family’s Qingming visit, dead Grandma Nai sneaks away from her peaceful afterlife after overhearing that her queer grandson is about to get engaged to a woman.
I Came with Earrings | 2024 | United States | Jonathan Caren | Midwest Premiere | On the day of an Aikido test, Leah’s adoptive mom gifts her with earrings that send her on a tailspin where she must overcome more than just a brown belt test.
*Mom’s Prank | 2024 | China | Zihao YU | U.S. Premiere | Told from the POV of a cheeky robot vacuum, this heartfelt comedy follows a clever mother who fakes tech trouble to lure her busy son home more often.
The Perfect Tomato | 2024 | United Stated, Mexico | Cristobal Abugaber | Midwest Premiere | An aging farmer refuses to leave his longstanding way of life behind at the risk of losing what truly matters to him.
Toots. | 2024 | United States | Chris Alan Evans | When her health declines due to Parkinson’s, a devoted son grapples with his new responsibilities as his mother’s caregiver. As he holds on tightly to childhood memories of her, she meanders through her own childhood memories. A revolving story of caring for one another emerges.
When We Move | 2024 | United States | Jasper Fletcher, Lukas Fletcher | Midwest Premiere | The youngest kid in a family of nine navigates moving houses for her very first time; documented over the course of a year by her oldest brothers.
HIGH SCHOOL FILM COMPETITION
Support the creativity of young student filmmakers from around the world!
The Audition | 2025 | United States | Isaiah Henderson | Alex prepares to audition for Hamlet with the help of his friend, Max, but his script mysteriously disappears.
*Brothers | 2024 | China | Adrian Wong | U.S. Premiere | Two boys living in Shanghai explore and discover themselves in the city.
**THE CALL | 2024 | United States | Paloma Williams | World Premiere | Amidst the urban twilight, two friends take photos at one of the last New York City phone booths when the phone begins to ring.
El Deseo (The Wish) | 2025 | Mexico, United States | Francesca Varese | Midwest Premiere | A terminally ill woman returns to the beach of her youth and remembers her first love in this emotional tale of magic, love and sacrifice.
FISHEYE | 2025 | United States | Eion Nunez | Midwest Premiere | A man in a concrete box fishes up something strange.
Foundation | 2024 | Australia | Jack Hinz | After experiencing the confronting realities of cow farming as a child, Anthony Walsgott abandons his life as a lawyer to purchase a pristine 120-acre block on Queensland’s Mary River—a place which is now home to Australia’s largest cow sanctuary.
Her First Time | 2024 | United States | Mikaela Brown-Cestero, Malia Antison | Midwest Premiere | A girl never forgets her first time.
I’m Fine | 2024 | United States | Aidan Sinconis | “I’m Fine” is a first-person tale of the struggle with teenage depression told through private journal entries. The film lifts the covers off the distorted perception of reality that comes from depression and gives a realistic view of improvement.
Keeper of the Night Sky | 2024 | Canada | Karina Loerchner | An adventurous little girl with an overactive imagination ventures into places she shouldn’t ought to be, and wreaks havoc on a poor unsuspecting dragon.
**Paper Boat | 2025 | South Korea | Yeobin Park | World Premiere | In a quiet countryside home, two children make and float paper boats as their world quietly shifts.
**Speed Bumps Ahead | 2024 | United States | Celina Ren, Sophia Faraone, Christina Labban | World Premiere | The United States is a country dominated by cars and highways, proving dangerous and inconvenient to millions. But how did that come to be?
Weathered | 2024 | United States | Patrick Jang | Midwest Premiere | Three teenagers openly share personal stories of struggle, resilience and growth in this exploratory documentary that highlights the incredible teenage ability to weather through tumultuous inner battles.
Why Can’t We Just Be Ghosts? | 2025 | United States | Patrick Jang | Midwest Premiere | A depressed ghost and his friend contemplate what it means to be alive in this thought-provoking satire.
HORROR 1
Experience thrills, chills and kills in this fan-favorite collection of horror shorts.
The Beguiling | 2024 | United States | ishkwaazhe Shane McSauby | What seems to be a burgeoning romance between two Indigenous people takes a sinister turn as one grows suspicious of the other’s Indigenous heritage. When confronted, deceit turns their romantic evening into a darkly comedic nightmare.
**The Littles | 2025 | United States | Andrew Duplessie | World Premiere | When 11-year-old Juliet stubs her toe on a loose floorboard, she unwittingly sets off a series of mysterious events. A faint noise and an unusual glow seeping through the cracks capture her curiosity. But as she investigates, Juliet finds herself pulled into a chilling, otherworldly encounter—one that will unravel the secrets of her home and alter her reality forever.
*Paranoia | 2024 | United Kingdom | Alina Bichieva | U.S. Premiere | Gila ignores her usual paranoia and lets her charming date sleep on the couch. After setting some boundaries she locks the bedroom door out of habit. Taylor wakes her in the middle of the night saying he’s having an asthma attack, but she hesitates when something doesn’t feel right.
The Pearl Comb | 2024 | United Kingdom | Ali Cook | Midwest Premiere | In 1893, an endearing Cornish fisherman’s wife captures the attention of the medical profession as the first person to ever cure someone of Tuberculosis.
Playing God | 2024 | Italy, France | Matteo Burani | A clay sculpture comes to life in the darkness of a workshop, surrounded by strange creatures.
*Sacra Lunaria | 2025 | Spain | Mey Montero | U.S. Premiere | In the 17th century, in the Aragonese Pyrenees, a family of women lives in the forest. One night, Gala, presumed dead, returns mutilated and claims to have escaped from the Inquisition. Her sisters must decide whether to trust her or not.
Triptych | 2024 | United Kingdom, Bulgaria | Sophia Ray | Provocative artist Margaux Kasser plans to destroy a Bosch masterpiece, claiming it’s performance art. But the artwork conceals a dark secret from her past. A horrific reckoning is coming. Margaux must fight to escape her fate.
HORROR 2
Creature, body and psychological horror stories await, if you dare …
The Angel | 2024 | United States | Barrett Burgin, Jessica Burgin | A Mormon pioneer folk horror. Two plural wives receive a mysterious visitation amidst the blood red stone of Southern Utah.
The Flacalta Effect | 2024 | United States | Rochée Jeffrey | After a drug with anti-aging properties has apocalyptic consequences, two Black sisters fight for their lives—and looks—in this satirical take on toxic beauty culture.
**Jake Goes On a Date | 2025 | United Kingdom | Robert Harold | World Premiere | A man undergoes a painful transformation before his big date in the city.
*Long Pork | 2024 | United States | Iris Dukatt | U.S. Premiere | In a Post-Roe America where theocracy reigns, a renowned butcher meets the political predator responsible for the killing of her daughter and exacts bloody revenge, setting the stage for a revolution.
SEEN | 2024 | United States, India | Dhwani Shah | “SEEN” is a psychological horror about Noori, a South Asian immigrant, haunted by a camera. As fear blurs into paranoia, the film explores the unsettling reality of surveillance, obsession and the quiet dread of being followed.
Stomach It | 2024 | United States | Peter Klausner | A crime scene cleaner struggles with emotionally detaching from the deceased’s personal possessions. While on a late night job, he convinces himself a monstrous presence is toying with him.
VHX | 2024 | United States, United Kingdom | Alisa Stern, Scott Ampleford | A collection of home movies languish on a shelf, longing to be watched again. Little do they know, there’s a fate far worse than being forgotten.
Zoé | 2024 | Canada | Rémi St-Michel | Midwest Premiere | The remaining shreds of Zoe’s mind desperately cling to her vague memories of better feelings.
THE HUMAN SPIRIT
Watch the indomitable strength of the human spirit across these extraordinary stories!
*A Friend of Dorothy | 2025 | United Kingdom | Lee Knight | U.S. Premiere | A lonely widow’s quiet life is upended when a teenage boy accidentally kicks his football into her garden.
Malka | 2025 | United States | Stacey Maltin | Midwest Premiere | Malka, a Holocaust survivor, starts to see visions of her life at the camps during a present-day family seder. As time falls in on itself, Malka must find the hope in the present that she did in the past in order to survive.
Rat Rod | 2025 | United States | Jared Jakins, Carly Jakins | Midwest Premiere | A haunted mechanic muses on his experiences as an immigrant in rural America while resurrecting cars.
Simple Machine | 2024 | United States | Sara Hendren | Midwest Premiere | “Simple Machine” follows an architect and father tinkering with classical mechanics in his garage wood-shop—and explores how his story taps the legacy of wartime technology, labor history, the mysteries of loss, chance, and adaptation, all in the inventive human body.
Sound of the Somme | 2025 | Belgium | Michaël Vermaercke | Midwest Premiere | The true story of James C. Richardson, a young bagpiper who risked his life to bring a glimmer of hope amidst the horrors of World War I.
